Main API Module

The main API module provides the core functionality for interacting with the HaasOnline API.

class pyHaasAPI.api.ApiResponseData

Any response from Haas API should be pydantic model or collection of them.

alias of TypeVar(‘ApiResponseData’, bound=BaseModel | Collection[BaseModel] | bool | str)

pyHaasAPI.api.HaasApiEndpoint

Known Haas API endpoints

alias of Literal[‘Labs’, ‘Account’, ‘HaasScript’, ‘Price’, ‘User’, ‘Bot’]

exception pyHaasAPI.api.HaasApiError[source]

Bases: pyHaasAPIExcpetion

Base Excpetion for pyHaasAPI.

class pyHaasAPI.api.UserState[source]

Bases: object

Base user API Session type.

__init__() → None
class pyHaasAPI.api.Guest[source]

Bases: UserState

Default user session type.

class pyHaasAPI.api.Authenticated(user_id: str, interface_key: str)[source]

Bases: UserState

Authenticated user session required for the most of the endpoints.

user_id: str
interface_key: str
__init__(user_id: str, interface_key: str) → None
class pyHaasAPI.api.State

Generic to mark user session typ

alias of TypeVar(‘State’, bound=Guest | Authenticated)

class pyHaasAPI.api.SyncExecutor(*args, **kwargs)[source]

Bases: Protocol, Generic[State]

Main protocol for interaction with HaasAPI.

execute(endpoint: Literal['Labs', 'Account', 'HaasScript', 'Price', 'User', 'Bot'], response_type: Type[ApiResponseData], query_params: dict | None = None) → ApiResponseData[source]

Executes any request to Haas API and serialized it’s reponse

Parameters:

  • endpoint – Actual Haas API endpoint

  • response_type – Pydantic class for response deserialization

  • query_params – Endpoint parameters

Raises:

HaasApiError – If API returned any error

Returns:

API response deserialized into response_type

__init__(*args, **kwargs)
class pyHaasAPI.api.RequestsExecutor(*, host: str, port: int, state: State, protocol: Literal['http'] = 'http')[source]

Bases: Generic[State]

First implementation of SyncExecutor based on requests library.

host: str

Address of the Haas API.

port: int

Port of the Haas API.

state: State

User session state.

protocol: Literal['http']

Communication protocol (currently only http is valid).

authenticate(email: str, password: str) → RequestsExecutor[Authenticated][source]

Creates authenticated session in Haas API

Parameters:

  • email – Email used to login into Web UI

  • password – Password used to login into Web UI

Raises:

HaasApiError – If credentials are incorrect

execute(endpoint: Literal['Labs', 'Account', 'HaasScript', 'Price', 'User', 'Bot'], response_type: Type[ApiResponseData], query_params: dict | None = None) → ApiResponseData[source]

Execute an API request.

__init__(*, host: str, port: int, state: State, protocol: Literal['http'] = 'http') → None

Client Module

The client module handles the low-level HTTP communication with the HaasOnline API.

Data models used throughout the library for type safety and validation.
